$40B หายไปใน 4 เดือน: การเดิมพัน Bitcoin ของ Strategy กลับมาทำร้ายตัวเองหรือไม่?

$40B erased in 4 months: Is Strategy’s Bitcoin bet backfiring?

TH

บริษัท Strategy ของ Michael Saylor กำลังเผชิญกับการตรวจสอบอย่างหนัก เนื่องจากการถือครอง Bitcoin [BTC] อยู่ในสภาพขาดทุนที่ยังไม่เกิดจริง (unrealized losses) กว่า 3.5 พันล้านดอลลาร์ และมูลค่าพอร์ตลดลงเกือบ 40 พันล้านดอลลาร์ในช่วง 4 เดือนที่ผ่านมา การดิ่งลงนี้เชื่อมโยงโดยตรงกับการราคา Bitcoin ที่ตกลงอย่างหนัก 19% ในรอบสัปดาห์ ส่งผลให้ราคาหุ้นของ Strategy ดิ่งตามไปด้วย อย่างไรก็ตาม บริษัทยังคงเป็นผู้ถือครอง Bitcoin ระดับองค์กรที่ใหญ่ที่สุดด้วยการถือครองไว้ประมาณ 713,502 BTC ความรู้สึกเชิงลบในตลาดส่งผลกระทบต่อบริษัทอื่นๆ ที่ใช้กลยุทธ์คล้ายกัน เช่น MARA Holdings, Metaplanet และ Riot Platforms ซึ่งต่างประสบกับการร่วงลงของราคาหุ้นอย่างมาก เมื่อดัชนีความกลัวและความโลภ (Crypto Fear and Greed Index) อยู่ในโซนความกลัวขั้นวิกฤต (extreme fear) นักวิจารณ์ชื่อดังอย่าง Michael Burry และ Peter Schiff จึงได้ออกมาเตือนอีกครั้งถึงความเสี่ยงจากการลงทุนใน Bitcoin ของบริษัทต่างๆ

EN

Michael Saylor’s Strategy is under intense scrutiny as its Bitcoin [BTC] holdings suffer over $3.5 billion in unrealized losses, with nearly $40 billion wiped from its portfolio in four months. This downturn is directly linked to Bitcoin's recent price crash, which saw the asset drop 19% in a week, subsequently dragging Strategy’s stock price down. Despite these losses, Strategy remains the largest corporate holder of Bitcoin with approximately 713,502 BTC. The negative market sentiment is impacting other firms that adopted a similar strategy, such as MARA Holdings, Metaplanet, and Riot Platforms, which are all experiencing significant stock declines. With the Crypto Fear and Greed Index signaling 'extreme fear,' prominent critics like Michael Burry and Peter Schiff have renewed their warnings about the risks of heavy corporate Bitcoin exposure.

Key Points

  • Strategy faces over $3.5 billion in unrealized losses as nearly $40 billion was erased from its crypto portfolio in four months due to Bitcoin's price drop.
  • Other companies following the 'Saylor playbook,' including MARA Holdings, Metaplanet, and Riot Platforms, are seeing significant stock declines and portfolio losses.
  • Market sentiment has hit 'extreme fear,' prompting warnings from critics like Michael Burry and Peter Schiff regarding the risks of heavy corporate Bitcoin exposure.

Article

Journalist Posted: February 6, 2026 For years, Michael Saylor’s Strategy has been seen as either brilliantly bold or dangerously reckless for its heavy bet on Bitcoin [BTC]. Now, that bet is under serious pressure. Recent data from The Kobeissi Letter shows that the company’s Bitcoin [BTC] holdings are sitting on more than $3.5 billion in unrealized losses. In just four months, nearly $40 billion has been erased from its crypto portfolio, one of the toughest challenges yet to Saylor’s conviction in holding Bitcoin through extreme volatility. Beyond the drop in prices, the deeper concern is how this strategy might impact corporate treasuries across the broader industry. Is Bitcoin’s price the reason behind this? Strategy’s losses are directly tied to Bitcoin’s recent crash. At the time of writing, CoinMarketCap data showed BTC trading at $70,849.57, down 6.61% in a single day and 19% over the past week. For a company whose core strategy revolves around Bitcoin, such declines have dealt a significant blow to its financial health. Consequently, Strategy’s stock also dropped, slipping to $129.09, a 4.17% decline. Still, despite these setbacks, Strategy remains the largest corporate holder of Bitcoin, with about 713,502 BTC in its portfolio. The Saylor playbook under pressure But other companies that copied this strategy are now feeling the impact too. At press time, MARA Holdings Inc. stock fell 8.51%, holding around 53,250 BTC, and hasn’t locked in losses yet, but pressure is building. Then, Metaplanet, often called Asia’s MicroStrategy, has dropped 30%. Additionally, its 35,102 BTC holdings are down about 34%. Riot Platforms was no exception, as its stock fell by 7.82% while holding 18,005 BTC. Together, these declines show that Saylor’s Bitcoin-focused strategy is being tested across the industry, not just at Strategy. Current market conditions draw concern Market sentiment has turned sharply negative. The Crypto Fear and Greed Index has dropped into the extreme fear zone, which usually signals panic selling. At this stage, even long-term holders often start selling to avoid bigger losses. This fear has brought back warnings from well-known critics. Michael Burry, best known for predicting the 2008 financial crash, has warned that companies heavily exposed to Bitcoin may face significant financial risks. Additionally, Peter Schiff, a longtime supporter of gold and Bitcoin skeptic, has pointed out that despite Bitcoin’s past gains, Strategy is now sitting on about a 3% unrealized loss. He has used this to question Michael Saylor’s long-term strategy, mocking it publicly on social media. Going by his style, Schiff put it best when he said, “I’m sure the losses over the next five years will be much greater!” Final Thoughts Extreme fear in the market signals that even loyal long-term holders are beginning to question their positions. Falling stock prices across crypto-linked firms suggest this is no longer just Strategy’s problem, it’s an industry-wide stress test.
